titleStmt.title: The true coppy of the complaint of Roderyck Mors, sometime a gray Fryer, unto the Parliament House of England, about an hundred yeares agoe, when the Bishop of Rome being banish'd out of the realme, the Bishops of England acted his part by power of the old Romish canon, newly translated into English law.
Complaynt of Roderyck Mors. Chapter 23.
titleStmt.author: Brinkelow, Henry, d. 1546.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed in time and place of publique observation of the English prelats, so contrary handling the matter with the peace-seeking Protestant subjects of Scotland, and the blood-sucking Popish rebells of Ireland,

notesStmt.note: Place of publication and publication date from Wing.
A reprint of chapter 23 of: The complaynt of Roderyck Mors.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
